channel.title: phenomics on CityU-Bioinformatics
channel.description: Recent content in phenomics on CityU-Bioinformatics

item.title: Bioimaging
item.description: Table of Contents Microscopic Phenotype Analysis Microscopic Image Formats Management OMERO | OME Remote Objects SCIFIO | SCientific Image Format Input and Output PheWAS PheWAS | Phenome-wide association study SPAtest Laser Scanning Microscopy FISH ImageJ GoIFISH Colocalization Analysis BioImageXD ViBE-Z | Virtual Brain Explorer for Zebrafish 3D Image Analysis u-track UltraTracer Conventional Fluorescence microscopy High-throughput Screening histoCAT | HIStology TOpography Cytometry Analysis Toolbox CellProfiler Cell Phenotyping PhenoRipper histoCAT | HIStology TOpography Cytometry Analysis Toolbox Super-resolution Imaging Morphometric Analysis MIB | Microscopy Image Browser BioImageXD Single Molecule Detection and Localization rapidSTORM ViSP Cryo-EM Neuron Tracing UltraTracer webKnossos Single Particle Analysis EMAN National Center for Macromolecular Imaging, The Verna and Marrs McLean Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology, Baylor College of Medicine, One Baylor Plaza, Houston, TX, USA EMRinger Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Microscopic Phenotype Analysis Microscopic phenotype analysis deals with all tools usefull for describing, identifying or classifying phenotypes at microscopic scale.

item.title: Brain Connectomics
item.description: Table of Contents Connectivity Analysis Functional Brain Connectivity BCT | Brain Connectivity Toolbox WholeBrain Structural Brain Connectivity BNRR WholeBrain Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (fMRI) 3D Image Surfacing ANTs | Advanced Normalization Tools Surfing | 3D image surfacing Diffusion Magnetic Resonance Imaging Analysis Tractography SlicerDMRI Dipy | Diffusion Imaging in Python Neuron Tracing NeurphologyJ | Neuron tracing : Bioimaging analysis Vaa3D | 3D Visualization-Assisted Analysis Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Connectivity Analysis The functional organization of the brain is characterized by segregation and integration of information being processed.

item.title: Computational Neuroinformatics
item.description: Table of Contents Biological Steps Realistic Neuronal Network Modelling The Virtual Brain Brian Compartment Neuron modelling NEURON neuroConstruct File Manipulation Model Files Conversion SBML2LaTeX Sbmlharvester Model Files Visualization SBMLToolbox SBMLEditor Model Building NeuroManager PyNN Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Modelling in computational neuroscience is becoming a crucial tool for understanding how experimentally observed properties of neural systems emerge from lower-level biophysical processes.

item.title: Medical Imaging
item.description: Table of Contents Medical Phrnotype Analysis Clinical Risk Prediction RICORDO | Researching Interoperability using Core Reference Datasets Department of Genetics, University of Cambridge, Cambridge, UK comoRbidity Clinical Simulation LMG | Lumbar Model Generator PIPER Child HBM Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) DICOM files management DicomBrowser | DICOM files management : Magnetic resonance imaging MIPAV | Medical Image Processing Analysis and Visualization Computerized Tomography Scan Imaging (CT) Phantom Imaging CTSim | Computed Tomography Simulator Image Format Management NiBabel Nuclear Medicine Imaging 3D Image Reconstruction STIR | Software for Tomographic Image Reconstruction NiftyPET Kinetic Analysis QModeling | Kinetic analysis : Nuclear medicine imaging Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Medical Phrnotype Analysis Macroscopic phenotype analysis deals with all tools usefull for describing, identifying or classifying phenotypes at macroscopic scale.

item.title: Neorophysiology
item.description: Table of Contents Neurophysiology Analysis PyNWB VERTEX | Virtual Electrode Recording Tool for EXtracellular potentials Clinical Eletrophysiology Spike Sorting NEV2lkit Spyke Viewer Image Data Analysis MNE-Python EEGLAB Data Management and Annotation NDManager Patch-clamp RTXI | Real-Time eXperiment Interface NeuroMatic Find more tools: OMICTOOLS Neurophysiology Analysis The techniques used in experimental neurophysiology have grown in complexity with the development of new technology.
